Description.Title: SnowAccumulation
Description.Institution: INRA (French National Institute for Agricultural Research)
Description.ExtendedDescription: SnowAccumulation is a simple daily snowfall partitioning routine from the STICS model. It computes the fraction of precipitation that falls as snow (fs) based on maximum air temperature thresholds: if tmax is below tsmax, all precipitation is snow; if above trmax, all is rain; between tsmax and trmax, a linear interpolation determines fs. Snowfall accumulation (Snowaccu) is then fs multiplied by daily precipitation, expressed as water equivalent.
Description.ShortDescription: Partitions daily precipitation into snowfall using temperature thresholds and linear interpolation.

Input.name: tsmax
Input.description: maximum daily air temperature (tmax) below which all precipitation is assumed to be snow

Input.name: trmax
Input.description: tmax above which all precipitation is assumed to be rain

Function.name: model_snowaccumulation
Function.description: Calculates snowfall fraction from temperature thresholds and multiplies by precipitation.
